org.jtrim.image.transform

Interface TransformationStepInput.Cmp

  • Enclosing class:
    TransformationStepInput

    public static interface TransformationStepInput.Cmp
    Defines a quick comparison of two TransformationStepInput instances. The comparison must be quick and should return false, if it cannot quickly determine the equality. That is, the comparison should be a constant time operation which should little more than comparing references.

    Note that, the comparison can be relative to a particular ImageTransformationStep. That is, it only needs to consider if the associated ImageTransformationStep will yield the same result for the two inputs or not.

    See Also:
    ImageTransformationStep, TransformationSteps.cachedStep

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isSameInput(TransformationStepInput input1, TransformationStepInput input2)
      Checks whether the two TransformationStepInput instances should be considered the same for a particular ImageTransformationStep.

    • Method Detail

      • isSameInput

        boolean isSameInput(TransformationStepInput input1,
                  TransformationStepInput input2)
        Checks whether the two TransformationStepInput instances should be considered the same for a particular ImageTransformationStep.

        The comparison should not do anything expensive. For example, it should avoid checking the pixels of the input images. Rather, it should compare the references of the needed input images. Also, if the associated ImageTransformationStep ignores some property of its input, this comparison should ignore them as well.

        This method should be commutative. That is, return the same value if its arguments are passed in the reverse order.

        Parameters:
        input1 - the first input object to be compared. This argument cannot be null.
        input2 - the second input object to be compared. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if the specified instances can be consider to be the same, false otherwise. This method may also return false, if it cannot quickly determine if the two inputs are equivalent or not.
